subject: Data
title: William Petty and Political Arithmetic
description: Learn William Petty and Political Arithmetic in one minute.

hook.text: In the 1670s, an English economist argued that governing without data was like sailing without a compass.

buildup.text: William Petty coined 'political arithmetic' â€” using numbers to guide government policy.

discovery.text: He measured Ireland's land, population, and resources to advise on taxation and trade.

twist.text: Critics mocked him. Politicians preferred intuition and tradition over cold numbers.

climax.text: Petty's methods became standard. Today no government operates without data-driven policy.

punchline.text: He told governments: stop guessing, start counting.

quiz.question: What did William Petty advocate for in governance?
options: Using data and numbers for policy decisions
